title: Use uploaded photo as the Yes success-screen image

requirements.summary: Add the uploaded photo as a generated static asset and swap the success-screen image to use it after clicking “Yes”.
acceptanceCriteria: A copy of the uploaded file Snapchat-1579100041.jpg is present under frontend/public/assets/generated with a stable filename (including .dim_WxH in the filename).
When the user clicks “Yes”, the success screen renders the uploaded image (via a /assets/generated/... path) instead of /assets/generated/heart-couple-portrait.dim_1024x1024.png.
The image is loaded directly by the frontend (no backend fetch) and displays correctly in preview/production.
The success screen keeps existing messages and animations unchanged; only the image source/alt text is updated as needed (alt text in English).

file_operations.description: Add a static asset copy of the uploaded Snapchat-1579100041.jpg at this stable generated filename (includes .dim_736x1472) so it is served directly from frontend/public.

On the success view (rendered after clicking “Yes”), replace the current image src (/assets/generated/heart-couple-portrait.dim_1024x1024.png) with /assets/generated/after-yes-photo.dim_736x1472.jpg and update only the img alt text (English) while keeping all existing success-screen messages, layout, and animations unchanged.
